'Cangjie programming language_struct_mut_mut_function_restrictions': 'In Cangjie code language, mut functions can only be defined within struct, interface, or extensions of struct.
mut functions cannot be defined within class because class is a reference type and its instance members can be modified without the mut keyword.
mut functions cannot capture this or be used as expressions.
Lambdas or nested functions within a mut function cannot capture the struct's instance member variables.
mut functions cannot be used on let-declared variables of struct type.
Non-mut instance member functions (including lambdas) cannot directly access mut functions within the same type.'
